entry.title: Anders Åkerman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Anders Åkerman started the production of terrestrial and celestial globes (example pictured) in Sweden?

entry.title: West Georgia Wolves football (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the West Georgia Wolves football team won 13 games in 13 years before folding, but upon returning two decades later compiled consecutive undefeated regular seasons and became national champions?

entry.title: Fūka Izumi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fūka Izumi became a voice actress despite initially doubting that she could be one?

entry.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1994 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that seven countries competed in the Eurovision Song Contest 1994 for the first time, the largest single expansion of participating countries since the contest's first edition?

entry.title: Aysu Türkoğlu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the young Turkish open water swimmer Aysu Türkoğlu has completed three of the Oceans Seven series?

entry.title: Senate Avenue YMCA (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Indianapolis African-American community raised $100,000 in just ten days in 1911 to establish the Senate Avenue YMCA?

entry.title: Phase One (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Edgar Wright's pitch for an Ant-Man film in 2006 helped to shape the early films of Phase One of the Marvel Cinematic Universe?

entry.title: Wallsocket (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while touring for her album Wallsocket, Underscores handed out pizza before her sets?

entry.title: The Glorious Cause: The American Revolution, 1763–1789 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Glorious Cause: The American Revolution, 1763–1789 has been the first, second, and third volume of the Oxford History of the United States?
